title: In Search of "Aryan Blood": Serology in Interwar
description:
In Search of "Aryan Blood": Serology in Interwar and National Socialist Germany



English | ISBN: 9639776505 | 256 pages | PDF | 3.2 MB

Explores the course of development of German seroanthropology from its origins in World War I until the end of the Third Reich. Gives an all encompassing interpretation of how the discovery of blood groups around 1900 galvanised not only old mythologies of blood and origin but also new developments in anthropology and eugenics in the 1920s and 1930s
